intro: Pedicularis incisopetala, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes species that are often parasitic or hemiparasitic. The plant features showy, spurred flowers that are typically pink or purple, and it has opposite, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. It thrives in alpine and subalpine habitats, often growing in rocky or gravelly soils. Due to its specialized habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
